member.name: T:Veldrid.Android.AndroidRuntime
member.summary: Function imports from the Android runtime library (android.so).

member.name: T:Veldrid.BackendInfoD3D11
member.summary: Exposes Direct3D 11-specific functionality, useful for interoperating with native components which interface directly with Direct3D 11. Can only be used on a GraphicsDevice whose GraphicsBackend is D3D11.

member.name: P:Veldrid.BackendInfoD3D11.Device
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the ID3D11Device controlled by the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: M:Veldrid.BackendInfoD3D11.GetTexturePointer(Veldrid.Texture)
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the native texture wrapped by the given Veldrid Texture. Depending on the instance's TextureType, this will be a pointer to an ID3D11Texture1D, an ID3D11Texture2D, or an ID3D11Texture3D.
member.returns: A pointer to the Veldrid Texture's underlying ID3D11Texture1D, ID3D11Texture2D, or ID3D11Texture3D. The type of this object depends on the parameter's TextureType.

member.name: T:Veldrid.BackendInfoOpenGL
member.summary: Exposes OpenGL-specific functionality, useful for interoperating with native components which interface directly with OpenGL. Can only be used on a GraphicsDevice whose GraphicsBackend is OpenGL.

member.name: M:Veldrid.BackendInfoOpenGL.ExecuteOnGLThread(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the given delegate in the OpenGL device's main execution thread. In the delegate, OpenGL commands can be executed directly. This method does not return until the delegate's execution is fully completed.

member.name: M:Veldrid.BackendInfoOpenGL.FlushAndFinish
member.summary: Executes a glFlush and a glFinish command, and waits for their completion.

member.name: M:Veldrid.BackendInfoOpenGL.GetTextureName(Veldrid.Texture)
member.summary: Gets the name of the OpenGL texture object wrapped by the given Veldrid Texture.
member.returns: The Veldrid Texture's underlying OpenGL texture name.

member.name: T:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan
member.summary: Exposes Vulkan-specific functionality, useful for interoperating with native components which interface directly with Vulkan. Can only be used on a GraphicsDevice whose GraphicsBackend is Vulkan.

member.name: P:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan.Device
member.summary: Gets the underlying VkDevice used by the GraphicsDevice.

member.name: P:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan.PhysicalDevice

member.name: P:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan.GraphicsQueue

member.name: P:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan.GraphicsQueueFamilyIndex
member.summary: Gets the queue family index of the graphics VkQueue.

member.name: M:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan.OverrideImageLayout(Veldrid.Texture,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Overrides the current VkImageLayout tracked by the given Texture. This should be used when a VkImage is created by an external library to inform Veldrid about its initial layout.
member.param: The Texture whose currently-tracked VkImageLayout will be overridden.
The new VkImageLayout value.

member.name: M:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan.GetVkImage(Veldrid.Texture)
member.summary: Gets the underlying VkImage wrapped by the given Veldrid Texture. This method can not be used on Textures with TextureUsage.Staging.
member.param: The Texture whose underlying VkImage will be returned.
member.returns: The underlying VkImage for the given Texture.

member.name: M:Veldrid.BackendInfoVulkan.TransitionImageLayout(Veldrid.Texture,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Transitions the given Texture's underlying VkImage into a new layout.
member.param: The Texture whose underlying VkImage will be transitioned.
The new VkImageLayout value.

member.name: F:Veldrid.BlendAttachmentDescription.OverrideBlend
member.summary: Describes a blend attachment state in which the source completely overrides the destination. Settings: BlendEnabled = true SourceColorFactor = BlendFactor.One DestinationColorFactor = BlendFactor.Zero ColorFunction = BlendFunction.Add SourceAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.One DestinationAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.Zero AlphaFunction = BlendFunction.Add

member.name: F:Veldrid.BlendAttachmentDescription.AlphaBlend
member.summary: Describes a blend attachment state in which the source and destination are blended in an inverse relationship. Settings: BlendEnabled = true SourceColorFactor = BlendFactor.SourceAlpha DestinationColorFactor = BlendFactor.InverseSourceAlpha ColorFunction = BlendFunction.Add SourceAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.SourceAlpha DestinationAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.InverseSourceAlpha AlphaFunction = BlendFunction.Add

member.name: F:Veldrid.BlendAttachmentDescription.AdditiveBlend
member.summary: Describes a blend attachment state in which the source is added to the destination based on its alpha channel. Settings: BlendEnabled = true SourceColorFactor = BlendFactor.SourceAlpha DestinationColorFactor = BlendFactor.One ColorFunction = BlendFunction.Add SourceAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.SourceAlpha DestinationAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.One AlphaFunction = BlendFunction.Add

member.name: F:Veldrid.BlendAttachmentDescription.Disabled
member.summary: Describes a blend attachment state in which blending is disabled. Settings: BlendEnabled = false SourceColorFactor = BlendFactor.One DestinationColorFactor = BlendFactor.Zero ColorFunction = BlendFunction.Add SourceAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.One DestinationAlphaFactor = BlendFactor.Zero AlphaFunction = BlendFunction.Add

member.name: T:Veldrid.CommandList
member.summary: A device resource which allows the recording of graphics commands, which can later be executed by a . Before graphics commands can be issued, the method must be invoked. When the is ready to be executed, must be invoked, and then should be used. NOTE: The use of is not thread-safe. Access to the must be externally synchronized. There are some limitations dictating proper usage and ordering of graphics commands. For example, a , , vertex buffer, and index buffer must all be bound before a call to will succeed. These limitations are described in each function, where applicable. instances cannot be executed multiple times per-recording. When executed by a , they must be reset and commands must be issued again. See .

member.name: M:Veldrid.CommandList.Begin
member.summary: Puts this into the initial state. This function must be called before other graphics commands can be issued. Begin must only be called if it has not been previously called, if has been called, or if has been called on this instance.

member.name: M:Veldrid.CommandList.End
member.summary: Completes this list of graphics commands, putting it into an executable state for a . This function must only be called after has been called. It is an error to call this function in succession, unless has been called in between invocations.

member.name: F:Veldrid.GraphicsDeviceOptions.PreferStandardClipSpaceYDirection

member.name: T:Veldrid.MapMode
member.summary: Identifies how a will be mapped into CPU address space.

member.name: F:Veldrid.MapMode.Read
member.summary: A read-only resource mapping. The mapped data region is not writable, and cannot be used to transfer data into the graphics resource. NOTE: This mode can only be used on resources created with the Staging usage flag.

member.name: F:Veldrid.MapMode.Write
member.summary: A write-only resource mapping. The mapped data region is writable, and will be transferred into the graphics resource when is called. NOTE: upon mapping a buffer with this mode, the previous contents of the resource will be erased. This mode can only be used to entirely replace the contents of a resource.

member.name: F:Veldrid.MapMode.ReadWrite
member.summary: A read-write resource mapping. The mapped data region is both readable and writable. NOTE: this mode can only be used on resources created with the Staging usage flag.

member.name: T:Veldrid.PixelFormat
member.summary: The format of data stored in a . Each name is a compound identifier, where each component denotes a name and a number of bits used to store that component. The final component identifies the storage type of each component. "Float" identifies a signed, floating-point type, UNorm identifies an unsigned integer type which is normalized, meaning it occupies the full space of the integer type. The SRgb suffix for normalized integer formats indicates that the RGB components are stored in sRGB format.

member.name: F:Veldrid.PixelFormat.R8_G8_B8_A8_UNorm
member.summary: RGBA component order. Each component is an 8-bit unsigned normalized integer.

member.name: F:Veldrid.PixelFormat.B8_G8_R8_A8_UNorm
member.summary: BGRA component order. Each component is an 8-bit unsigned normalized integer.

member.summary: Single-channel, 8-bit unsigned normalized integer.

member.summary: RGBA component order. Each component is a 32-bit signed floating-point value.

member.summary: BC3 block compressed format.

member.name: M:Veldrid.ResourceFactory.CreateTexture(System.UInt64,Veldrid.TextureDescription)
member.summary: Creates a new from an existing native texture.
member.param: A backend-specific handle identifying an existing native texture. See remarks.
The properties of the existing Texture.
member.returns: A new wrapping the existing native texture.
member.remarks: The nativeTexture parameter is backend-specific, and the type of data passed in depends on which graphics API is being used. When using the Vulkan backend, nativeTexture must be a valid VkImage handle. When using the Metal backend, nativeTexture must be a valid MTLTexture pointer. When using the D3D11 backend, nativeTexture must be a valid pointer to an ID3D11Texture1D, ID3D11Texture2D, or ID3D11Texture3D. When using the OpenGL backend, nativeTexture must be a valid OpenGL texture name. The properties of the Texture will be determined from the passed in. These properties must match the true properties of the existing native texture.

member.name: M:Veldrid.ResourceFactory.CreateTexture(System.UInt64,Veldrid.TextureDescription@)
member.summary: Creates a new from an existing native texture.
member.param: A backend-specific handle identifying an existing native texture. See remarks.
The properties of the existing Texture.
member.returns: A new wrapping the existing native texture.
member.remarks: The nativeTexture parameter is backend-specific, and the type of data passed in depends on which graphics API is being used. When using the Vulkan backend, nativeTexture must be a valid VkImage handle. When using the Metal backend, nativeTexture must be a valid MTLTexture pointer. When using the D3D11 backend, nativeTexture must be a valid pointer to an ID3D11Texture1D, ID3D11Texture2D, or ID3D11Texture3D. When using the OpenGL backend, nativeTexture must be a valid OpenGL texture name. The properties of the Texture will be determined from the passed in. These properties must match the true properties of the existing native texture.

member.summary: An array containing the raw shader bytes. For Direct3D11 shaders, this array must contain HLSL bytecode or HLSL text. For Vulkan shaders, this array must contain SPIR-V bytecode. For OpenGL and OpenGL ES shaders, this array must contain the ASCII-encoded text of the shader code. For Metal shaders, this array must contain Metal bitcode (a "metallib" file), or UTF8-encoded Metal shading language text.

member.name: F:Veldrid.TextureViewDescription.Format
member.summary: An optional which specifies how the data within will be viewed. If this value is null, then the created TextureView will use the same as the target . If not null, this format must be "compatible" with the target Texture's. For uncompressed formats, the overall size and number of components in this format must be equal to the underlying format. For compressed formats, it is only possible to use the same PixelFormat or its sRGB/non-sRGB counterpart.

member.summary: A value controlling how often data for instances is advanced for this layout. For per-vertex elements, this value should be 0.
